Opportunity [Description]: Join our WSIS+20 Working Group and help shape the future of global Internet policy. Outreach Activity [Title]: Community Dialogue: The Evolution of the Internet Governance Forum (IGF)
Opportunity [Description]: Hear from our community expert, Flávio Wagner from our Brazil Chapter, how the IGF has evolved over its 20 years of existence and join a lively discussion on which role the IGF should play in the future, and how.
Why It Matters: The WSIS+20 review is a pivotal moment for the global community to take stock of two decades of progress toward achieving the WSIS vision, and the IGF mandate needs to be renewed by the UN.
Who Can Get Involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni

Outreach Activity [Title]: WSIS+20 Five-Point Plan Follow-up: Eight Practical Recommendations
Action [CTA]: Endorse the WSIS+20 Five-Point Plan Follow-up: Eight Practical Recommendations
Opportunity [Description]: Following our endorsement of the Five-Point Plan in March, we have been working with Global Partners Digital (GPD) and a group of cross-stakeholders in drafting Eight Practical Recommendations for the WSIS review with the aim of presenting tangible recommendations on how the WSIS co-facilitators can facilitate a transparent and inclusive process for the WSIS review.
Why It Matters: These practical recommendations seek to ensure transparency, inclusivity, and meaningful stakeholder engagement in the WSIS+20 review process.
Who Can Get Involved: Individual Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members

Outreach Activity [Title]: Expert Group for a Technology Roadmap on Encryption [European Commission]
Action [CTA]: Apply to join the European Commission’s Expert Group for a Technology Roadmap on Encryption
Opportunity [Description]: The European Commission is forming an informal Expert Group to “focus on current and future technical challenges impacting lawful access to digital information in the context of criminal investigations”. It is looking for technically skilled professionals with domain-specific expertise, especially in cybersecurity, telecom, big data analysis, digital forensics, fundamental rights, and data technologies.
Why It Matters: There are concerns about how the “Technology Roadmap on Encryption” frames strong encryption as a barrier to the EU's internal security and describes “lawful access” as an uncontested goal. We see active Internet Society community participation in the Expert Group as a way to ensure that future work on this is well-informed and balanced.
Who Can Get Involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni

Outreach Activity [Title]: Internet Society's New Advocacy Strategy – Session 1
Action [CTA]: Join our Community Call [English, French, Spanish]
Opportunity [Description]: Learn about our new Advocacy Strategy—a bold, collaborative effort to strengthen our ability to influence the decisions that shape the Internet’s future. Whether you're a long-time advocate or just getting started, your voice and actions matter. Join us to discover how you can play a key role in advancing our shared mission and defending what makes the Internet a force for good.
Why It Matters: Advocacy is more than speaking out. It’s an organized effort to influence policies, institutions, and actions that directly impact the Internet and the people who depend on it. As threats to an open, globally connected Internet grow, our collective voice and strategic action are more critical than ever.
Who Can Get Involved: Individual Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni
